page.title: 19Work and leisure at Wroxton.
page.content: The students who attend the College come in two age groups. There are the undergraduates who are, usually, aged from 20 to 24 and post-graduates who are from 22 to 70 plus. The students have on average a two hour lecture each week with two hour seminars every other week. Once a fortnight groups of two or three students have tutorials. They are expected to write papers and produce tutorial reports every two weeks. If they use their time wisely they should have 4 to 6 hours a day for leisure activities. Whilst they are in England they are taken to places of interest such as London, York, Scotland, and as part of their course they also visit the theatre at Stratford-upon-Avon etc. The students also have a 10 day travel recess when they are able to visit the Continent.
